Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectom.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

ossicular chain reconstruction.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

microdissection.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

NIM facial nerve monitoring.context: Left canal wall down tympanomastoidectomy with ossicular chain reconstruction, microdissection, NIM facial nerve monitoring for three hours.

extremely large canal cholesteatoma.context: There is an extremely large canal cholesteatoma, which eroded most of the posterior and superior canal wall.

myringosclerosis.context: There was a significant amount of myringosclerosis and tympanosclerosis.

tympanosclerosis.context: There was also a large focus of tympanosclerosis between the stapes crura, which was impinging the ability of the stapes to move.

mild erosion of the lenticular process o.context: There is some mild erosion of the lenticular process of the incus.

removed the incus.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

removed the head of the malleus.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

titanium-PORP.context: We removed the incus, removed the head of the malleus, and placed a titanium-PORP from the stapes capitulum to a cartilage graft.

cerumen.context: We inspected the ear canal, identified the huge defect, which was completely filled with cerumen.

epinephrine.context: Through the ear canal, we removed as much as we could and then infiltrated the canal and postauricular area with 1:100,000 of epinephrine.

cholesteatoma.context: A #6 cutting bur was used to drill down the mastoid cortex and identified this cholesteatoma which was then carefully dissected out.

mastoidectomy.context: We finished a complete mastoidectomy with identification of the tegmen, sigmoid sinus.

perforation.context: There was no cholesteatoma within the middle ear space, but there was roughly 40% surface area perforation.

calcified and myringosclerotic tympanic.context: The remaining portion of the tympanic membrane was extremely calcified and myringosclerotic; this was removed.

temporalis fascia.context: We tried to go ahead and harvest the temporalis fascia, but there was really only wisps of this fascia in place.

corticosteroid usage.context: I suspect this was due to his chronic disease and long history of corticosteroid usage.

meatoplasty.context: We went ahead and did a meatoplasty by making a canal incision in the 6 o'clock and 12 o'clock positions.

Gelfoam.context: We placed some Gelfoam in the middle ear space and placed the cartilage on the top of it.

Merocel packs.context: We placed a layer of Gelfoam lateral to the graft, closed the postauricular incision in layers and put 2 Merocel packs in the ear.

antibiotics and pain medicines.context: He will be given antibiotics and pain medicines and he will be given instructions to follow up with me in one week.
